title: Rational and Irrational Numbers

vocab.definition: A number that can be written as a fraction of two integers
A number that cannot be written as a simple fraction
All rational and irrational numbers together
A number whose square root is a whole number
A value that is close to the exact value

teachingNotes: Use examples like π and √2 to show irrational numbers. Practice estimating square roots of non-perfect squares.

sample.question: What is a number that can be written as a fraction of two integers?

truefalse.question: The square root of 2 is an irrational number.

multiplechoice.question: Which is an example of an irrational number?

fillintheblank.question: All rational and irrational numbers together are called ________ numbers.

shortanswer.question: Is 0.25 rational or irrational? Explain.
expectedAny: rational, can be written as fraction

wordProblems.question: Estimate √50 to the nearest whole number by finding perfect squares near 50.
